description: a(n) is the smallest positive number such that the sum of A001032(n) consecutive squares starting with a(n)^2 is a square.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: Laurent Beeckmans, Squares Expressible as Sum of Consecutive Squares, Am. Math. Monthly, Volume 101, Number 5, pp. 437-442, May 1994.
Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
crossrefs: Square roots of sum are in A076215.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, _Mira Bernstein_
extensions: Better description and more terms from _Ralf Stephan_, Nov 03 2002
Offset corrected to 1 by _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 02 2016
